content.title: National Handicrafts Development Programme: Research & Development Scheme
content.details: The 'Research & Development Scheme' is a component of the Umbrella Scheme 'National Handicrafts Development Programme (NHDP)' by the Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. The scheme is introduced to generate feedback on the economic, social, aesthetic, and promotional aspects of various crafts and artisans in the handicraft sector. Under this scheme, the surveys and studies are sponsored/conducted to generate suitable inputs for planning purposes. Also, workshops, seminars, conferences, radio programs, etc. are organized in online as well as offline mode to sensitize the artisans on the latest development in the Handicrafts sector.
benefits: The financial assistance shall be extended to eligible organizations as 100% grants in aid.
Payments to all beneficiaries/concerned must be made through PFMS only.
Disbursement of the assistance will be in two installments: 75% as advance and 25% as reimbursement.
eligibility: Public body or institution having a distinct legal entity.
Institutions or Organizations setup as Autonomous Organisations, under a specific statute or as a society registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860, or Indian Trusts Act, 1882.
Producer Companies and Section-8 Companies (Company Act, 2013).
Urban and Rural Local Self-government Institutions.
National Crafts Museum & Hastkala Academy, New Delhi.
content.application_process: Online. Eligible agencies should submit the proposal for conducting Study/Survey and/or Seminar/workshop through the prescribed proforma.
documents_required: Valid Registration Certificate under proper statute/copy of empanelment certificate of DC (HC) in case of NGO / copy of incorporation certificate in case of companies.
Three years Balance Sheet, Annual Report & audited balance sheet/statement of accounts.
All documents should be attested by Implementing Agency.
Copy of Empanelled Certificate issued by O/o DC (Handicrafts).
Name and address of the Bank, Account Number, and IFSC code.

faqs.question: How Will The Selection Of The Artisans Be Done?
faqs.answer: Any artisans having a Pahchan card may participate in the seminar/workshop.

faqs.question: Is There Any Reservation/Preference/Priority In The Selection Of The Artisans?
faqs.answer: Yes, preference may be given to marginalized social groups.

faqs.question: What Is The Purpose Of The NHDP: Research & Development Scheme?
faqs.answer: To generate feedback on economic, social, aesthetic, and promotional aspects of various crafts and artisans.
